page.title: 10Local Press
page.content: (The Harborough Mail)is the established local newspaper.We visited the editor Mr Gordon Birch,and discussed this weeks issue (June 13th 1985). The leading article is about sweets that might be mistaken for pills.Also on the front page is Alan Bott,sausage making champion of Britain.Reader's letters concerned,the rail service,flouridating water,dogs fouling sreets,and demolishing an old pub.(The Harborough Post)has been published since Oct.'84.It is a free newspaper to over 13,000 homes weekly. It's revenue comes from advertisers.On the front page of June 13th edition is a photograph of ourselves talking to the editor Mr Langley.The editor sees the paper as having a "bright future" because of it's "lively style and coverage of local people and events". .
